actions.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 103-228.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 81.
Mr. Traficant moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Baucus without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 491.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 103-287.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse in Lubbock, Texas, as the "George H. Mahon Federal Building and United States Courthouse".

summary.text: Designates the Federal building and United States courthouse at 1205 Texas Avenue, Lubbock, Texas, as the George H. Mahon Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse in Lubbock, Texas, as the "George H. Mahon Federal Building and United States Courthouse".
